meanings.definition: To make the sound of (a word or letter) with one's voice.
meanings.sent1: She was pronouncing the word 'cat' very clearly.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys pronouncing new words he learns.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was pronouncing words better than the teacher!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, pronouncing joy.
meanings.sent5: The singer was pronouncing each note beautifully.

meanings.definition: To declare or announce formally or officially.
meanings.sent1: The judge was pronouncing the verdict in the courtroom.
meanings.sent2: The mayor will be pronouncing the new law tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The cat was pronouncing itself the king of the house.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm pronounced its arrival with a loud boom.
meanings.sent5: The principal was pronouncing the winner of the competition.

meanings.definition: To utter or articulate (words) in the correct way.
meanings.sent1: He was pronouncing the foreign words perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The teacher helped the students with pronouncing difficult sounds.
meanings.sent3: The robot was pronouncing words with a funny accent.
meanings.sent4: His actions pronounced his loyalty to the cause.
meanings.sent5: The actress was pronouncing her lines flawlessly.
